instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: Guys is this the chip or some kind of capacitor? Mid 2010 15 inch

Guys is this the chip or some kind of capacitor? Mid 2010 15 inch
threads.message: Reball the Gmux, horrible job. Its super unlikely to be a bad chip on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boards.

Guys is this the chip or some kind of capacitor? Mid 2010 15 inch
threads.message: MUX issue and of course change <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> while you are at it.

threads.title: Guys is this the chip or some kind of capacitor? Mid 2010 15 inch
threads.message: What do you guys mean by GMUX? the <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>?

threads.title: Guys is this the chip or some kind of capacitor? Mid 2010 15 inch
threads.message: Yes <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>. First pull one on a scrap board and see if you even want to attempt this.

threads.title: Guys is this the chip or some kind of capacitor? Mid 2010 15 inch
threads.message: I've gotten by with reflowing it but you must be very careful to not get any of that rubberish junk on the side under the chip. I bake the board at 300f for a half hour before removing that stuff and do the reflow while it is still warm from toaster oven.

threads.title: Guys is this the chip or some kind of capacitor? Mid 2010 15 inch
threads.message:
[QUOTE="larossmann, post: 14224"]I've gotten by with reflowing it but you must be very careful to not get any of that rubberish junk on the side under the chip. I bake the board at 300f for a half hour before removing that stuff and do the reflow while it is still warm from toaster oven.[/QUOTE]

Yes that what we did in the end, removed the rubber junk(what purpose does it even serve?) and heated the chip up to 210 degrees using a BGA machine, it's working fine now let's see what happens.
Some chinese guy is selling the balled chip on ebay, i bought two let's see if they are worth it. 

Arash

threads.title: Guys is this the chip or some kind of capacitor? Mid 2010 15 inch
threads.message: If it really heated till 210 nothing will happen. Lead free solder needs 220

threads.title: Guys is this the chip or some kind of capacitor? Mid 2010 15 inch
threads.message: After heating to 220 there is no picture anymore, boots and you can hear the OS running but no picture at all, any idea?

threads.title: Guys is this the chip or some kind of capacitor? Mid 2010 15 inch
threads.message: Pull and reball, preferably a chip from a donor board.
